result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius Deshone Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:23 AM Defendant Demetrius Deshone Williams in court, in custody.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense with Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Demetrius Deshone Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed plea questionnaire filed today.  Court conducted colloquy with defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  State and Defense made statements to the Court regarding sentencing.  

**COUNT 1**

7 Days Jail/Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.(Credit - 16 days).  TIME SERVED.

FINE or COSTS: $ 243.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
9 DAYS CREDIT TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS AND DNA SURCHARGE.


Restitution:  $1056.85 to be paid to Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint.  
AMOUNT TO BE IMMEDIATELY CONVERTED TO CIVIL JUDGMENT.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22
